text: The Bahing are a subset of the Indigenous Kirat ethnic group, located widely in Okhaldhunga and Solukhumbu District. They can be found in some of the villages like Bulaadi, Chisopani, Moli, Pankhu, Bhaudure, Apsowra, Rangadeep, Bigutar, Mamkha, Narayasthan, Baruneshowe, Ratmate, Waksa, Lekh Kharka of the Okhaldhunga District, and Nechabatase, Salyan of Solukhumbu & in some other districts of eastern Nepal. Their language, also named Bahing, belongs to the family of Kiranti languages, a subgroup of Tibeto-Burman. They have two main festivals: Hong and Susu.Kirat Mundhum The Bahing also worship in Nature. ==References== Category:Ethnic groups in Nepal Category:Himalayan peoples
title: Bahing
